titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Rich Family Collection 1864-1972
titlestmt.author: Henry Adams

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-01-16.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS (Describing Archives: A Content Standard), 2nd Edition.

did.abstract: The Rich Family Collection consists of the personal and family records of the Rich family, dating from 1864 to approximately 1972. This collection contains a bible, and a scrapbook with photographs documenting the boxing career of Henry Rich, and other family documents.

acqinfo.p: Donated to the Whitman College and Northwest Archives by William O'Flaherty on May 31, 2017. The accession number is 2018-011.

bioghist.p: Omar Whitman Rich, born September 15, 1863, was a farmer and a teacher who married Abbie Angeline Brown, born April 24, 1874, in June 1891. They sent three of their children to Whitman College in Walla Walla, Washington: Theodore "Ted" Rich, who graduated in 1921 with a degree in Economics, Louise Rich Buck, who graduated in 1928, and Henry Rich, who boxed in the Walla Walla area under the pseudonym Richie Davis. The Rich family are direct descendants of Samuel Whitman, the grandfather of Marcus Whitman.

scopecontent.p: The Rich family collection houses the personal and family records of the Rich family. This collection, dating from 1864 to approximately 1972, consists of a bible owned by David Whitman, a scrapbook documenting the boxing career of Henry Rich, photographs of Whitman College campus and the Rich family, and newspaper clippings. This collection mainly documents the Rich family and their involvement in both Whitman College and the Walla Walla area.
